examples:
$ sfdx repl:repl --targetusername me@example.com
me@example.com> Math.sqrt(289)
17
me@example.com> $conn.identity().then(id => console.log('*** you are logged into Salesforce as: ' + id.username))
Promise { _40: 0, _65: 0, _55: null, _72: null }
me@example.com> *** you are logged into Salesforce as: me@example.com
$ sfdx repl:repl -e "1 + 2"
3
Note that many interactions with Salesforce will return JavaScript Promises, which
can be difficult to work with in an interactive environment. Use --experimental-repl-await
to make things a bit easier:
$ NODE_OPTIONS=--experimental-repl-await sfdx repl:repl -u me@example.com
me@example.com> (await $conn.identity()).username
'me@example.com'

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

repl:script.description: runs a script using the SFDX REPL
